info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 20 at 3:01AM CDT until March 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
...NEAR CRITICAL TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING AND AGAIN FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY EVENING...
The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from noon today to 9 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 208 Niobrara Valley/Fort Niobrara NWR/Samuel R McKelvie National Forest.
* TIMING...Noon through 9 PM CDT Thursday.
* WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent.
* TEMPERATURES...Up to 63.
* LIGHTNING...Not Expected.
* IMPACTS...Any fire starts have a good potential to spread rapidly and may be difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA

area.areaDesc: Niobrara Valley/Fort Niobrara NWR/Samuel R McKelvie National Forest
